description.narrative:
1) Job creation: The Project will create job opportunities, including in frontier regions, for local communities and women.
2) Development of frontier regions: The Project will finance the expansion of proximity discount stores in the local neighborhoods across the country, including frontier regions.
3) Boost formality and tax generation: The shops will contribute to boost formality and tax generation.
4) Impact on customers: The Project will provide quality products at very competitive price, thus helping in improving the living standards for the local population. The Project targets to reach the vast majority of the national population and will focus primarily on low- and middle-income groups.
5) Support of SMEs: The Project will strengthen the SME suppliers and the local supply chain, a vast majority of the products sold in the shops being sourced and produced locally.

Jeronimo Martins, SGPS, SA (the Group), one of the largest European food retailers, has requested IFC to provide a long-term loan to partially finance the next two years investment plan of its subsidiary, Ara Tiendas (Ara) in Colombia. Ara is a chain of neighbourhood food retail stores, having started its operations in 2013 in Colombia. Over the next couple of years its expansion plan includes both the opening of new stores and distribution centres that will provide logistic support to the stores (the Project).
